docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Harry Reid scheduled the first crucial procedural vote on the major health care legislation for Saturday, after what is expected to be two marathon days of debate.

headline.main: Senate Health Care Bill Faces Crucial First Vote
headline.print_headline: Senate Health Bill Covers Fewer Than House Version, but Would Cost Less

docs.snippet: Senator Harry Reid scheduled the first crucial procedural vote on the major health care legislation for Saturday, after what is expected to be two marathon days of debate.

docs.lead_paragraph: The House on Thursday approved a $210 billion measure to avert steep cuts in Medicare payments to doctors. The bill passed by a vote of 243 to 183, with just one Republican joining 242 Democrats in support. Voting against it were 172 Republicans and 11 Democrats.
docs.abstract: House, 243 to 183, passes $210 billion measure to avert 21 percent cut in Medicare payments to doctors set to take effect in January and prevent future cuts; fate of bill is uncertain in Senate (M)
docs.snippet: The House on Thursday approved a $210 billion measure to avert steep cuts in Medicare payments to doctors.     The bill passed by a vote of 243 to 183, with just one Republican joining 242 Democrats in support. Voting against it were 172 Republicans...

docs.lead_paragraph: Some abortion-rights advocates grudgingly say that they will support the Senate health-care bill, which omits some of the more restrictive anti-abortion language approved by the House. But they are not rushing to embrace it. ''It is not the pro-choice position,'' said Marcia Greenberger, co-president of the National Women's Law Center.
docs.abstract: Some abortion-rights advocates give grudging support to Senate health-care bill, which omits some of more restrictive anti-abortion language approved by House, but are not rushing to embrace senate version (M)
docs.snippet: Some abortion-rights advocates grudgingly say that they will support the Senate health-care bill, which omits some of the more restrictive anti-abortion language approved by the House. But they are not rushing to embrace it.     ''It is not the...

docs.lead_paragraph: The insurance industry lobby is panning the Senate legislation.The lobbying group, America's Health Insurance Plans, said in a statement on Thursday that the bill would increase costs for individuals, families and employers; reduce benefits for older Americans; and threaten employer coverage.
docs.abstract: The insurance industry finds little to like in the Senate health care bill, saying it would increase costs for individuals, families and employers, reduce benefits for seniors and threaten employer coverage.
docs.snippet: The insurance industry finds little to like in the Senate health care bill, saying it would increase costs for individuals, families and employers, reduce benefits for seniors and threaten employer coverage.

docs.lead_paragraph: Reaction to the Senate Democrats' health care bill is starting to trickle in, now that various interest groups have had a little time to digest it. And even among some allies, the reaction is somewhat mixed.

headline.main: From the Left, Modest Praise for Senate Bill

docs.abstract: Even supporters offer mixed reactions to the Senate bill.
docs.snippet: Even supporters offer mixed reactions to the Senate bill.

docs.lead_paragraph: Representative John Conyers Jr., Democrat of Michigan and the second-most senior member of the House, today ripped into President Obama and Rahm Emanuel, the White House chief of staff, accusing them of "bowing down" to "nutty right-wing" proposals just to get a health care bill passed.

headline.main: Conyers Derides White House Strategy on Health Care

docs.abstract: A senior House Democrat pines for "the Barack Obama that I first met, who was an ardent single-payer enthusiast."
docs.snippet: A senior House Democrat pines for "the Barack Obama that I first met, who was an ardent single-payer enthusiast."

docs.lead_paragraph: New York State's highest court rejected unanimously a challenge on Thursday by opponents of same-sex marriage to policies that recognize such unions performed in other states, though the decision gave gay advocates a small victory because it was narrowly written and applied to a relatively small number of people.

headline.main: Court Upholds Recognition of Gay Marriages in Narrow Ruling

docs.abstract: The State Court of Appeals upheld two government policies that recognize same-sex marriages performed in other states.
docs.snippet: The State Court of Appeals upheld two government policies that recognize same-sex marriages performed in other states.

docs.lead_paragraph: In December, the Senate approved a sweeping legislation to overhaul the nation’s health care system. The House approved its bill in November. The proposals are broadly similar but differ on some major issues, like a new government insurance plan, abortion and how to pay for the expansion of coverage. A look at some key differences between the proposals:

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Cotton was a labor lawyer whose negotiating savvy helped improve the wages and conditions of tens of thousands of meatpacking workers.

headline.main: Eugene Cotton, Labor Union Lawyer, Dies at 95

docs.lead_paragraph: Attempts to discredit the health reform proposals now before Congress resemble the flawed arguments made in the 1960s.
